item.description:
Piece of Cake

Reinvesting in Collective Creativity
& Community

Griffin Museum

January 6, 6-9 PM

Open to the public

Admission - FREE

 

Join us for a presentation by Piece of Cake (POC), a photographic collective founded by French photographer Charles Fréger in 2002.

 

What started as a casual meeting between artists has become a close network of photographers in Europe and North America, whose purpose is to interact as they create, and to share their talents through collaborative projects and personal discussions during semi-annual workshops.

 

The spirit of POC is to resurrect the communal spirit of camera clubs, with a focus on collaboration over competition. Sharing resources becomes an integral part the creative process.

 

This presentation features members of POC North America: Alejandra Laviada, Amy Stein, Aspen Mays, Bill Sullivan, Birthe Piontek, Brian Ulrich, Cara Phillips, John Mann, Jonathan Gitelson, Justin James Reed, Kelli Connell, Ofer Wolberger, Timothy Briner, Will Steacy, and William Lamson.

 

The group introduces opportunities available to photographers who wish to build their own networks and benefit from artists gathering together for discussion, resource sharing, and friendships. Presentation topics include community over competition; sharing resources; fostering professional relationships that extend beyond online interactions; focus on creating group momentum through individual talents, book publishing, and professional practices.
item.how_to_find_us: Its a gathering - so just come on by and join in!

group.name: Worcester Alliance of Photographers - AKA: WAP

item.name: Piece of Cake:Reinvesting in Collective Creativity & Community @ Griffin Museum
